global.name: platformName
global.appium_description: Which mobile OS platform to use
usage_tips: Happium only supports iOS and Android - FirefoxOS is only technically supported since appium allows it

global.name: deviceName
global.appium_description: The kind of mobile device or emulator to use

valid_options.ios_value_tip: Any of the devices returned by instruments with 'instruments -s devices'
valid_options.android_value_tip: Exact value is currently ignored - the only requirement is that this capability exists

usage_tips: You can technically put whatever value you want in as the value for Android, though this may not be useful
By default, Happium sets this value to the value from the device property 'ro.product.model'

global.name: app
global.appium_description: The absolute local path or remote http URL to an .ipa or .apk file, or a .zip containing one of these. Appium will attempt to install this app binary on the appropriate device first.

valid_options.value_tip: Absolute local path or remote HTTP URL to an .ipa, .apk, or a .zip container

usage_tips: If you have a remote build server, all you need to provide is the URL to the location of the build
In Android Appium sessions, you can set 'appPackage' and 'appActivity' INSTEAD of 'app'
In iOS Appium sessions, you can set 'bundleId' instead of 'app'

global.name: udid
global.appium_description: Unique device identifier of the connected physical device

valid_options.ios_value_tip: The device's UDID (you can find this using iTunes with the device connected)
valid_options.android_value_tip: The value for the device property, 'ro.product.serialno'

usage_tips: Though it's not clear from the Appium documentation, for Android, UDID is also the serial number returned from the command 'adb devices'
Even though 'udid' is a required capability, it is only required for real device testing, which Happium employs exclusively

android.name: appActivity
android.appium_description: Activity name for the Android activity you want to launch from your package. This often needs to be preceded by a '.' (e.g., .MainActivity instead of MainActivity)
usage_tips: It's most useful to set this to the name of the activity that runs on startup
This capability (along with 'appPackage') IS required if you are not using the 'app' capability
'appActivity' does not work by itself - you must also specify 'appPackage' to use it

android.name: appPackage
android.appium_description: Java package of the Android app you want to run
usage_tips: The application must be installed on the device in order for this to work
This capability (along with 'appActivity') IS required if you are not using the 'app' capability
'appPackage' does not work by itself - you must also specify 'appActivity' to use it

android.name: autoGrantPermissions
android.appium_description: Have Appium automatically determine which permissions your app requires and grant them to the app on install.
usage_tips: Permission prompts can disrupt automation scripts - because of this, it's recommended you set this to 'true'

ios.name: bundleId
ios.appium_description: Bundle ID of the app under test. Useful for starting an app on a real device or for using other caps which require the bundle ID during test startup.
usage_tips: The device must be installed on the device in order for this to work

ios.name: autoAcceptAlerts
ios.appium_description: Accept all iOS alerts automatically if they pop up. This includes privacy access permission alerts (e.g., location, contacts, photos). Default is false. Does not work on XCUITest-based tests.
usage_tips: Permission prompts can disrupt automation scripts - because of this, it's recommended you set this to 'true'
